articles.title: DPRK Delegation Back Home
articles.content:
DPRK Delegation Back Home
 Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the DPRK led by Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, Saturday flew back home after taking part in the 17th NAM Summit held in Venezuela.

articles.title: DPRK Premier Makes Field Survey of Sunchon Cement Complex
articles.content:
DPRK Premier Makes Field Survey of Sunchon Cement Complex
 Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Pak Pong Ju made a field survey of the Sunchon Cement Complex and held a consultative meeting on the issue of increasing cement production.
					 The meeting underlined the need for the complex to play its responsible role as arsenal of the front for recovering from flood damage in the northern part of the country by unconditionally carrying out in time the tasks for cement production set forth by the Party for the front ranks of the 200-day campaign of loyalty.
					
					 It raised a new goal of increased production suited to the expansion of the drive for recovering from flood damage in the northern part of the country and took measures to ensure the most effective use of the existing production foundation.
					
					 Earlier, the premier went round railway lines for exclusive use for campaign for recovering from flood damage and encouraged railway transport workers to immediately send cement to the above-said front.

articles.title: 70th Anniversary of Agricultural Publishing House Marked
articles.content:
70th Anniversary of Agricultural Publishing House Marked
 Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- The Agricultural Publishing House marked its 70th founding anniversary.
					 President Kim Il Sung founded the magazine Korean Agriculture on September 25, Juche 35 (1946) and guided the publishing house's work for releasing magazines and books so that it might play the role as powerful weapon promoting development of agricultural science of the country and the settlement of food problem for the people.
					
					 Leader Kim Jong Il led the Agricultural Publishing House to discharge its mission and set forth the significant day of the first agricultural magazine founded by the President as the foundation day of the publishing house.
					
					 For the past seven decades since its foundation the Agricultural Publishing House has developed into publication and information service base with strong editing force and good conditions and fulfilled the honorable duty of dynamically arousing agricultural workers and officials to implement the Party's policy for agricultural revolution.
					
					 A meeting to mark the 70th anniversary of the publishing house took place on Sunday.
					
					 The congratulatory message sent by the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea to the journalists, editors and officials of the publishing house was conveyed at the meeting.

articles.title: Tribute Paid to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Tribute Paid to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- The participants in the 10th Pyongyang International Science and Technology Book Fair Sunday visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun.
					 They paid high tribute to President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il before their statues.
					
					 They made bows to the great leaders in the halls where they lie in state.
					
					 They went round the halls where orders the great leaders received are on display and the halls that house cars, electric car, boat and train coaches used by them during their field guidance and foreign tours till the last moments of their lives.

articles.title: Gifts to Kim Jong Un from Delegations, Delegates to Int'l Book Fair
articles.content:
Gifts to Kim Jong Un from Delegations, Delegates to Int'l Book Fair
 Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un received gifts from a delegation of the State Administration of Press and Publication, Radio, Film and Television of China and the executive director of the Environmental Education Media Project on a visit to the DPRK to take part in the 10th Pyongyang International Science and Technology Book Fair.
					 The gifts were separately conveyed to an official concerned.
					
					 Gifts to Kim Jong Un from the Far Eastern Branch of the Russian Academy of Sciences and the China Association for International Friendly Contact were conveyed.

articles.title: More Aids Sent to Flood-hit Areas
articles.content:
More Aids Sent to Flood-hit Areas
 Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- A campaign to help residents in the flood-hit northern part of North Hamgyong Province is steadily going on in the DPRK.
					 North Phyongan Province sent thousands of builders to the flood-hit areas while giving priority to transporting foodstuff and daily necessities to those areas.
					
					 The province has sent a large amount of food grain, 223,000 pieces of necessities like quilt, underwear and towel and 22,000 pieces of different tools and materials. Jongju City in the province rendered sincere aids including thousands pieces of clothes, hundreds pairs of shoes and 1,600 articles of utensils.
					
					 Industrial establishments in Jagang Province boost production of building materials and necessities for the people in the northern part of North Hamgyong Province.
					
					 The province, in particular, pushes ahead with the production of fixtures and household electric appliances, taking due measures for increased steel production.
					
					 Up to present, the province has provided those flood-hit areas with a great number of foodstuffs like grain, meat and egg and medicines and hundreds of thousands of daily necessaries and school things.
					
					 South Hwanghae Province, too, supplied over 200,000 sacks urgently needed for cement transportation and sent 50,000 meters of vinyl pipes, 11,000 pieces of building parts and varieties of necessities to the flood-hit areas.

articles.title: Achievements Made by Kim Chaek University of Technology in DPRK
articles.content:
Achievements Made by Kim Chaek University of Technology in DPRK
 Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Chaek University of Technology in the DPRK has recently made signal achievements in the education science.
					 It manufactured electronic blackboards based on ultrasonic wave and mouse and created about 400 new teaching methods.
					
					 More than 6 700 teaching plans were put on a practical, comprehensive and modern basis, 14 000 e-teaching plans were drawn up and over 100 experimental apparatuses and simulation and practice software developed at the university.
					
					 Meanwhile, the university has made a significant progress in the scientific researches conducive to the country's economic modernization.
					
					 Its researchers settled sci-tech problems arising in updating the acrylic paints production process at the Sunchon Chemical Complex and invented more than one hundred pieces of equipment in tens of kinds needed to put the Pyongyang Cornstarch Factory's production processes on an automated and unmanned basis.
					
					 And they developed PLC software for silk-reeling machine at the Kim Jong Suk Pyongyang Silk Mill.

articles.title: Large Stockbreeding Base in Sepho Tableland of DPRK
articles.content:
Large Stockbreeding Base in Sepho Tableland of DPRK
 Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- Sepho tableland in Kangwon Province of the DPRK turns into a better large-size stockbreeding base with each passing day.
					 Increasing in every pasture of the area are the turnout of fodder grass and the number of grass-eating animals in herds.
					
					 Phyonggang Meat Factory and other meat and feed processing bases and dwelling houses took their shapes in the tableland, renewing its looks.
					
					 Meanwhile, the builders reaped a good harvest of "Aegukphul", a high-yielding and nutritive feed crop for livestock, by planting it in the field of scores of hectares this year.

articles.title: DPRK's Nuclear Deterrence Guarantees Peace and Security of Country: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
DPRK's Nuclear Deterrence Guarantees Peace and Security of Country: Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- The DPRK's nuclear deterrence provides a sure guarantee for reliably deterring the U.S. moves for a nuclear war and firmly defending the peace and security of the country, says Rodong Sinmun Sunday in an article.
					 The distress-torn history of the Korean nation teaches a bitter lesson that if it is weak in arms, it cannot defend its sovereignty and it is bound to meet a more miserable fate than a dog in the house of death, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 The sovereignty of south Korea is being ruthlessly trampled down by foreign forces. The U.S. imperialists' presence in south Korea is the root cause of violating the sovereignty and dignity of the nation and hindering its uniform development.
					
					 The DPRK has built matchless nuclear deterrence capable of beating back any aggressors at one blow despite difficulties and ordeals under the unfurled banner of Songun because it could not tolerate the arbitrary practices of the U.S. to mock at the destiny of the Korean nation under the motto of Yankee-style pragmatism that meeting one's own interests precisely means "truth" and logic of the jungle law. 
					
					 The U.S. and the Park Geun Hye group of traitors are running the whole gamut of invectives such as the DPRK's daily increasing nuclear deterrence is posing "grave threat," regarding it as a thorn in their flesh. But these jargons are nothing but desperate frenzy of those doomed as dregs of history who are well aware that they can never realize their ambition for invading the north.
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK will reliably protect the destiny and dignity of the country and the nation with a firm grip on the steel-strong war deterrence which represents the muscle of justice and finally make a clean sweep of foreign forces and the group of traitors and proudly build a peaceful and prosperous reunified power on this land.

articles.title: Papers Ridicule S. Korean Puppet Forces Begging for Cooperation in Campaign for Pressurizing DPRK
articles.content:
Papers Ridicule S. Korean Puppet Forces Begging for Cooperation in Campaign for Pressurizing DPRK
 Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- South Korean puppet Minister of Foreign Affairs Yun Pyong Se poked his nose into the recent talks between the foreign ministers of the U.S. and Japan held in New York and blustered that "if they fail to strongly react to the nuclear capability of the north which has reached a high level, it would bring worldwide disaster" and cried out for "a comprehensive counteraction going beyond the north's expectation". Not content with this, they staged the farce of adopting a joint statement urging cooperation in the campaign for pressurizing the DPRK in a bid to take the 71st UN General Assembly an occasion of stirring up the atmosphere of slapping international sanctions against the DPRK and ratcheting up pressure on it.
					 Papers here Sunday in their commentaries ridicule it as a poor charade of confrontation maniacs, taken aback by the might of the DPRK which ranked itself among the nuclear powers.
					
					 The worn-out "sanctions and pressure" racket frantically kicked up by the Park Geun Hye group is prompted by its cynical ploy to hide its setbacks at any cost and beg its masters to prevent the atmosphere of stifling the DPRK from sinking, Rodong Sinmun says, and goes on:
					
					 It is the fixed faith and will of the army and people of the DPRK that if there are its territory and the Workers' Party of Korea, the DPRK government and water and air, they will certainly shatter any harsh sanctions and pressure and achieve prosperity in the spirit of self-reliance and self-development.
					
					 The hostile forces' ever more undisguised sanctions and pressure on the DPRK only reinforce the conviction that the DPRK is advancing and winning victories.
					
					 Minju Joson says the desperate efforts of the Park Geun Hye group to stifle the DPRK in collusion with foreign forces will only invite curse and condemnation by all Koreans and precipitate their final ruin.

articles.title: S. Korean Women Subject to Serious Discrimination
articles.content:
S. Korean Women Subject to Serious Discrimination 
 Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- Not a single woman is employed at major public service enterprises of south Korea, according to the south Korean CBS on September 21.
					 It was reported that not a single woman has been employed at 30 public service enterprises by the end of the first six months of this year, according to the analysis made of employment there by a website specializing in the assessment of management of enterprises.
					
					 This goes to prove that Park Geun Hye's commitment to increasing the proportion of women employees at public service enterprises to 30 percent was nothing but hypocrisy.
					
					 The position of the south Korean women can never improve as long as the Park Geun Hye group stays in power as it is prolonging its remaining days through fascist dictatorship and unpopular rule.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities' Humiliating Action Disclosed
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities' Humiliating Action Disclosed
 Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- It was disclosed that the south Korean authorities shaped a budget of more than a hundred million won for the "foundation for reconciliation and recovery" which was cooked up according to the humiliating "agreement" on the issue of sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army, the south Korean CBS said on September 21.
					 The puppet Ministry of Women and Families reportedly provided 150 million won to the "foundation for reconciliation and recovery" under the pretext of activities for aiding NGOs recently.
					
					 It was also disclosed that a billion yen from the Japanese government is not meant for reparation to be paid with legal responsibility but for providing aid to overseas development.
					
					 The south Korean public circles express their resentment at the humiliating behavior of the south Korean authorities.

articles.title: Federation of Banking Workers Unions of S. Korea Launches General Strike
articles.content:
Federation of Banking Workers Unions of S. Korea Launches General Strike
 Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- The Federation of Banking Workers Unions of south Korea launched a general strike in protest against the Park Geun Hye group's policy against workers including the system of paying salaries according to piece rate, according to the south Korean KBS.
					 A rally for the general strike with the attendance of at lest 50,000 workers took place in Seoul on September 23.
					
					 Chairman of the federation Kim Mun Ho said introduction of the above-said system would break commonness of the bank field and damage would go to consumers.
					
					 The participants in the rally expressed resolute protest against the introduction of the system, saying that the authorities are enforcing evil labor policy despite the strong opposition of the workers.

articles.title: National Events for Reunification Called for
articles.content:
National Events for Reunification Called for 
 Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Federation of Koreans in the U.S. made public a statement on September 21 demanding the Park Geun Hye regime ensure national events for reunification.
					 The statement said the joint meeting of the political parties, organizations and individual personages in the north, the south and abroad for peace and independent reunification of the Korean peninsula was not held owing to the obstructions of the U.S. and the Park Geun Hye regime.
					
					 The Korean nation will surely bring the joint meeting to success despite the obstructive moves of the south Korean authorities, the statement noted, adding no one can block the grand march of the Korean nation for independence and peaceful reunification.
					
					 The statement went on: National reunification should be achieved peacefully by the concerted efforts of the Koreans transcending differences in ideology, ideal and social system on the principle of the great national unity. This is the immutable truth.
					
					 Outside forces and sycophants should stop blocking the way of the Korean nation advancing for reunification under the unfurled banner of independence, peaceful reunification and great national unity and immediately quit before suffering greater misfortune.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Speech at 9th Congress of Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League Introduced by Bulgarian Body
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Speech at 9th Congress of Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League Introduced by Bulgarian Body
Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- The full text of "Let Us Usher in a Golden Age of the Kimilsungist-Kimjongilist Youth Movement" made by supreme leader Kim Jong Un at the 9th Congress of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League was posted by the Bulgarian Group for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism on its website on Sept. 20.

articles.title: DPRK's Nuclear Deterrence Will Be Further Bolstered Up: Chilean Social Body
articles.content:
DPRK's Nuclear Deterrence Will Be Further Bolstered Up: Chilean Social Body
 Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- The Chilean Branch of the Korean Friendship Association on Sept. 20 made public a statement supporting the DPRK's nuclear warhead explosion test.
					 The statement said:
					
					 Owing to the U.S. and its vassal forces' acts of terrorism, peoples of many countries including Iraq and Libya were killed.
					
					 However, thanks to the self-defensive nuclear deterrence, the people of the DPRK have lived a happy life despite the ceaseless aggression moves of the U.S. imperialists and their vassal forces.
					
					 If the country had not possessed of its own nuclear deterrence, it would have met the same fate as Iraq and Libya.
					
					 The DPRK's nuclear deterrence will be further bolstered up if the imperialists increase nuclear threats to the country.
					
					 The U.S. and its allies are now shocked by the recent test.
					
					 The world progressives are supporting the explosion test that demonstrated the dignity and might of the DPRK.

articles.title: Brazilian Paper Urges UN to Fulfill Its Mission as Int'l Body
articles.content:
Brazilian Paper Urges UN to Fulfill Its Mission as Int'l Body
 Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- The 32nd issue of a Brazilian paper carried an article titled "For whom does the UN exist?"
					 The paper said that the UN was founded more than 70 years ago out of the aspiration of the people of each country to deter the holocaust of war and the international community's unanimous desire to protect the peace and security of the world and promote the economic development by pooling efforts.
					
					 Today, the international arena has turned into the great powers' theater of rowdyism where even elementary principles in international relations including the respect for the sovereignty of countries and their territorial integrity, peaceful settlement of international disputes and non-interference in other's internal affairs on which mankind agreed and stipulated are ignored.
					
					 The UN can never serve the U.S. for the reason that its building is in its land.
					
					 However, the U.S. is pretending itself to be "Interpol" putting the agencies of the UN Secretariat under its control, regarding the UN an institution affiliated to it.
					
					 The U.S. and its vassal forces are imposing unprecedented sanctions on the DPRK and putting military pressure on it, branding it as an "unpardonable country" and "root cause of evil" in the international community.
					
					 However, the UN has done nothing to condemn the U.S. high-handed and arbitrary practices only to adopt the "resolution of sanctions" against the DPRK.
					
					 The UN had better fulfill its mission as an international body to fairly meet the requirements and wishes of the people of each country desirous of the peace and security of the world rather than hamper the independent desire and development by putting pressure on sovereign countries including the DPRK with double standards, double ruler, centered on a country.
					
					 This is the unanimous desire of the international community on the anniversary of the UN.

articles.title: DPRK Will Turn into Developed Socialist State: Int'l Body Figure
articles.content:
DPRK Will Turn into Developed Socialist State: Int'l Body Figure
 Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- Radio Sputnik of Russia reported an interview of its journalist and Alejandro Cao de Benos, chairman of the Korean Friendship Association headquartered in Spain on Sept. 8.
					 It said:
					
					 The chairman told the journalist that he became a supporter to the DPRK, being fascinated by the Juche idea founded by President Kim Il Sung and the idea put up by the DPRK.
					
					 The DPRK will in the future become a very developed and future-oriented socialist state, he said, noting that the Korean peninsula should be reunified in the spirit of the joint declarations adopted and published at the historic north-south summits.
					
					 He went on:
					
					 Like other countries, the DPRK, too, has the right to protect its territory and nation.
					
					 The DPRK's nuclear weapons are self-defensive ones from A to Z. If it had had no access to nuclear deterrence, it would have been just like Iraq and Libya long ago.
					
					 All accusations against the DPRK were produced by the U.S.
					
					 Only when the U.S. occupation of south Korea that has lasted for more than half a century ends, the situation on the Korean peninsula can be stable.

articles.title: UK Body Introduces S. Korean People's Struggle to Settle Accounts with Japan over Crimes Related to Sexual Slavery
articles.content:
UK Body Introduces S. Korean People's Struggle to Settle Accounts with Japan over Crimes Related to Sexual Slavery
 Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy posted an article titled "Bitter grudge" on its website on Sept. 15.
					 Actions of south Korean people are going on to settle accounts with Japan over its crimes related to the sexual slavery, the article said.
					
					 The Foundation for Preserving Justice to Settle the Issue of Sexual Slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army and other civic and public organizations held a press conference outside the Japanese Embassy in Seoul on August 31 at which they published a declaration denouncing Japan for trying to conceal the unethical crimes related to sexual slavery with a petty amount of money and the Park Geun Hye group of traitors for yielding to such act, it noted.
					
					 The declaration demanded the south Korean authorities nullify the wrong "agreement" immediately and dissolve the "Foundation for Reconciliation and Recovery", it pointed out.
					
					 Then the 1 246th Wednesday rally took place at the same place, it said, and went on:
					
					 The participants in a statement strongly demanded the abrogation of the humiliating "agreement", saying: We denounce Japan for working hard to conceal the historic truth with a petty amount of money and the Park Geun Hye regime for its despicable swindles.
					
					 Meanwhile, there appeared a memorial park for the victims of sexual slavery on Nam Hill, Seoul on August 29.
					
					 The park was created not to forget the heinous unethical crimes Japan committed against Korean women but to remember the victims of sexual slavery.
					
					 Girl statues indicting Japan's crimes related to sexual slavery are being erected in south Korea and the rest of the world in succession.

articles.title: U.S. Is to Blame for DPRK's Nukes: Nepali Paper
articles.content:
U.S. Is to Blame for DPRK's Nukes: Nepali Paper
Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- The Nepali newspaper Diary Express carried an article on Sept. 12.
					 The article said:
					
					 The DPRK successfully carried out the nuclear warhead explosion test some days ago.
					
					 In recent years the DPRK has made great progress in developing the national defence.
					
					 U.S. President Obama released a "statement" in which he said that the DPRK's test posed a "threat and challenge" to peace and security.
					
					 The DPRK, however, is going along its own way.
					
					 The U.S. is wholly responsible for making the DPRK have access to nukes.
					
					 The DPRK is forced to have access to the nuclear deterrent for self-defence under the worst conditions where there have been persistent sanctions and threats from the U.S. for a long time.
